options.content: ### On the map above: - Black hatched circles indicate areas where satellite data is extracted. Select locations using the "Satellite Time Series Extraction Locations" dropdown at top left. - Green polygons (left) indicate NERRS locations, where nutrients and meteorological parameters are measured. - Red rectangle indicates the Gray's Reef National Marine Sanctuary boundary. - The black dot inside the sanctuary boundary indicates the location of NDBC Mooring 41008 where meteorological and ocean acidification parameters are measured. - "12 nm" and "24 nm" lines indicate the 12 nautical mile Territorial Sea and 24 nautical mile Contiguous Zone Maritime Boundaries. Data is from NOAA's Office of Coast Survey. ### Directions for site navigation: Click the panel titles below to expand data panels. To look at satellite time series, select location(s) using the the location number in the "Satellite Time Series Extraction Locations" dropdown menu at left. Select mean, climatology or anomaly using the "Time Series Metric" dropdown menu. Gauge height from the USGS is available from six locations (green dots on the map). Select river(s) to display using the "USGS River Gauge Location" dropdown menu. The range of the displayed time period can be adjusted at top right.

panels.title: Welcome to the Gray's Reef NMS data dashboard

options.content:
#### Data Catalog
 - Near real time (NRT) datasets are displayed on the dashboard as soon as they are available.  
 - Some datasets require manual downloading from deployed instruments and become available at irregular intervals once downloading and QC are complete.   
 - Some datasets consist of samples processed in a laboratory and become available at irregular intervals once processing and QC are complete.    


###### A table of with the duration and frequency of each dataset displayed on the dashboard is shown below.  
###### Further information on each dataset is shown at the top of the respective panel.  

| Dataset                         | Start Date |  End Date  |  NRT?  | Frequency |      Notes                                 | 
| --------------------------------| ---------- |  --------  | ------ | --------- | ------------------------------------------ |
| Satellite Images                | Jan 2012   |  Present   |  Yes   |  Weekly   |  Satellite data is from the VIIRS sensor*  | 
| Satellite Time Series           | Jan 2012   |  Present   |  Yes   |  Daily    |  Time series are extracted daily           |
| NERRS WQ Data                   |            |            |  Yes   |  Hourly   |  Start date depends on NERR location       |
| NERRS Nutrient Data             |            |            |  No    |  Monthy   |  Start date depends on NERR location       |
| Meteorological and Wave Data    |            |            |  Yes   |  Hourly   |  Start date depends on NDBC buoy location  |
| Ocean Acidification Data        |            |            |  No    |  Hourly   |                                            |

*Algal Bloom Index (ABI) comes from the MODIS satellite sensor  

### List of acronyms:
ABI - Algal Bloom Index  
GRNMS - Gray's Reef National Marine Sanctuary  
MODIS - Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (ocean color satellite)  
NDBC - National Data Buoy Center  
NERRS - National Estuarine Research Reserve System  
NRT - Near real time  
OA - Ocean Acidification  
QC - Quality control  
RRS - Remote Sensing Relfectance  
SST - Sea Surface Temperature   
VIIRS - Visible Infrared Imaging Spectrometer Suite (ocean color satellite)

panels.description:
VIIRS-SNPP 750-m chlorophyll-a concentration (mg/m^3) binned to 7-day intervals.
Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: Weekly chlorophyll anomalies (mg/m^3)

panels.description:
VIIRS-SNPP 750-m nighttime sea-surface temperature (DegC) binned to 7-day intervals.
Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: Weekly nighttime SST anomalies (DegC)

panels.description:
VIIRS-SNPP 750-m remote sensing reflectance (sr^-1) at 671nm binned to 7-day intervals. This is a proxy for suspended sediments at the surface.
Anomaly images are created by subtracting a 7-day climatology using data from 2013-2019.
panels.title: Weekly red reflectance (suspended sediment proxy) anomalies (sr^-1)

panels.description: Dynamic seascapes are classified using multivariate  data and describe basin and gyre scale features and seasonal boundary shifts.  A description of seascape classes can be found [HERE](https://shiny.marinebon.app/seascapes/classes.html).
panels.title: 8-Day Biogeographic seascape classes

targets.query:
SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) as metric FROM "chlor_a"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "sstn"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "Rrs_671"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

SELECT mean(/^$metric$/) AS anomaly FROM "Kd_490"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$Locations$/) AND anomaly!=-999 AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval),"location" fill(null)

options.content:
### NERRS water quality and nutrient data is from the Sapelo Island location:
Water quality and nutrients are measured at four locations within the Sapelo Island NERR:
1. Cabretta Creek
2. Dean Creek
3. Hunt Dock
4. Lower Duplin

Please select locations(s) to visualize at the top.

 - Data are obtained from the NOAA National Estuarine Research Reserve System (NERRS) System-Wide Monitoring Program (SWMP). 
 - Water quality and meteorological data are accessed nightly from the [NOAA NERRS Centralized Data Management Office website](http://www.nerrsdata.org) 
 - Quality flags are applied to all NERRS SWMP data as described [HERE](https://cdmo.baruch.sc.edu/data/qaqc.cfm).
 - Nutrients are sampled monthly as part of routine monthly monitoring at each NERRS site. Data are made available once per year after a series of quality control checks.
 

![logo image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/marinebon/mbon-dashboard-server/client-seus/static_files/NERRS_logo_sm.jpg)

panels.title: Data from National Estuarine Research Reserves System (NERRS)

targets.query:
SELECT ATemp as ATemp FROM "nerrs"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$NERR_Locations$/) AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

SELECT DO_mgl FROM "nerrs"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$NERR_Locations$/) AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

SELECT Turb FROM "nerrs"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$NERR_Locations$/) AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

SELECT pH FROM "nerrs"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$NERR_Locations$/) AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

SELECT Sal FROM "nerrs"
WHERE ("location" =~ /^$NERR_Locations$/) AND $timeFilter 
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

options.content:
#### Station 41008 is a 3-m discus buoy located within Gray's Reef National Marine Sanctuary (31.40°N, 80.87°W). Water depth at this location is 16m.

#### Meteorological parameters:
1. Wind speed (m/s) averaged over an eight-minute period 3.8m above sea level.
2. Wind direction (the direction the wind is coming from in degrees clockwise from true N) over an 8-minute period 3.8m above sea level. 
3. Peak 5 second gust speed (m/s) measured during the eight-minute or two-minute period 3.8m above sea level. 
4. Significant wave height (m) is the average of the highest one-third of all of the wave heights during the 20-minute sampling period.
5. Air temperature (C) measured 3.4m above sea level.
6. Water temperature (C) measured 2m below water line.
7. Dominant wave period (seconds) is the period with the maximum wave energy.
8. Average wave period (seconds) of all waves during the 20-minute period. 
9. Mean Wave Direction (MWD) - the direction from which the waves at the dominant period (DPD) are coming. The units are degrees from true North, (North = 0 (zero) degrees and East = 90 degrees.

Data is obtained from the [National Data Buoy Center](https://www.ndbc.noaa.gov/station_page.php?station=41008).

panels.title: Meterological and wave conditions within Gray's Reef NMS

targets.query:
SELECT mean("wind_speed") FROM "meteorology" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("sea_surface_wave_significant_height") FROM "meteorology" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("wind_speed_of_gust") FROM "meteorology" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("sea_surface_temperature") FROM "meteorology" 
WHERE  $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("air_temperature") FROM "meteorology" 
WHERE  $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("sea_surface_wave_mean_period") FROM "meteorology" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("sea_surface_wave_period_at_variance_spectral_density_maximum") FROM "meteorology" 
WHERE $timeFilter 
GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

options.content:
## Ocean acidification parameters measured at the NDBC 41008 mooring (31.40°N, 80.87°W).

####  - Data shown in this panel has undergone post-calibration and a full set of quality control checks and ends in 2019. Please adjust the time interval at top right to see data prior to 2019.
####  - Recent data without full QC is available [HERE](https://www.pmel.noaa.gov/co2/story/Grays+Reef).

 - The National Data Buoy Center (NDBC) [Mooring 41008](https://www.ndbc.noaa.gov/station_page.php?station=41008) is located 40 nautical miles Southeast of Savannah, Georgia in Gray's Reef National Marine Sanctuary. 
 - On July 17, 2006 PMEL in collaboration with NDBC and researchers from the University of Georgia deployed a MAPCO2TM system on the NDBC 41008 buoy. 
 - Dr. Scott Noakes and Wei-Jun Cai are collaborating with us to maintain the system and have been deploying other sensors and making a variety of biogeochemical measurements in the Sanctuary. 
 - For more information about complimentary projects at Gray's Reef visit the [Gray's Reef researcher's webpage](https://graysreef.noaa.gov/science/research/researchers/welcome.html).
 - On September 19, 2011, a surface seawater pH sensor was added to the Grays Reef mooring. By measuring pH in addition to pCO2, we are able to more accurately and precisely study the changes associated with ocean acidification. 
 - This project is supported by [NOAA's Ocean Acidification Program](https://oceanacidification.noaa.gov/).

Parameters:
1. Partial pressure of CO2 in air (micro atm).
2. Partial pressure of CO2 in water (micro atm).
3. Seawater salinity (psu).
4. Seawater pH (unitless).
5. Water temperature (degreesC).

targets.query: SELECT ApCo2 FROM oa_params

panels.title: Partial pressure of CO2 in air (micro atm)

targets.query: SELECT WpCo2 FROM "oa_params"

panels.title: partial pressure of CO2 in water (micro atm)

targets.query: SELECT pH FROM "oa_params"
SELECT Sal FROM "oa_params"
SELECT WTemp FROM "oa_params"

SELECT /^$metric$/ FROM gh
WHERE (location = '$gauge_location' AND $timeFilter )
GROUP BY "location" fill(null)

options.content:
* Satellite data is from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS-Aqua) sensor and is obtained from the [Ocean Biology Processing Group](https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/) at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center.

* Algal Bloom Index (ABI) is calculated using the method of [Hu and Feng 2016](https://www.spiedigitallibrary.org/journals/journal-of-applied-remote-sensing/volume-11/issue-01/012003/Modified-MODIS-fluorescence-line-height-data-product-to-improve-image/10.1117/1.JRS.11.012003.full?SSO=1)

* River gauge height data (green cicles on map) are obtained from the [USGS National Water Information System](https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis).  

* Dynamic seascapes are classified using multivariate satellite data and describe basin and gyre scale features and seasonal boundary shifts. They are obtained from [NOAA's Coastwatch](https://cwcgom.aoml.noaa.gov/erddap/griddap/noaa_aoml_seascapes_8day.graph). A description of seascape classes can be found [HERE](https://shiny.marinebon.app/seascapes/classes.html).

Please feel free to contact us with questions:

Dr. Daniel Otis - [dotis@usf.edu](mailto:dotis@usf.edu)

list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM gh WITH KEY=location WHERE "region"='SEUS'

list.name: NERR_Locations
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM nerrs WITH KEY=location
